\begin{abstract}
We discuss the design and current status of the CIZA survey, the first
systematic X-ray search for clusters of galaxies in the Galactic plane
region. So far, we have compiled a sample of more than 70 X-ray
selected clusters at $|b|<20^{\circ}$, 80\% of which were previously
unknown. Upon its completion the CIZA cluster catalogue will
complement the existing galaxy surveys in the Galactic plane region
and allow a fresh look at large-scale structure and local streaming
motions.

\end{abstract}
